meanings.definition: A round stone fruit with juicy yellow flesh and pinkish-orange skin.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a ripe peach for dessert.
meanings.sent2: The peach tree in our garden is full of fruits.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole my last peach!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as a peach.
meanings.sent5: The peach juice dripped down my chin as I took a bite.

meanings.sent1: She painted her room in a lovely peach shade.
meanings.sent2: The sunset painted the sky in beautiful peach hues.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy clouds looked like cotton candy in peach.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned peach with embarrassment.
meanings.sent5: The peach-colored dress complemented her skin tone perfectly.

meanings.definition: To inform on someone; to betray.
meanings.sent1: He decided to peach on his friends to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to peach on her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to peach on its owner's secrets.
meanings.sent4: Betrayal stings like a peach gone bad.
meanings.sent5: He chose to peach to save himself from punishment.
